Package gamePackage

Class Game

java.lang.Object
gamePackage.Game
public class Game extends Object
The Game class represents a game of blackjack. All games have a gameName, a user interface, a deck of cards, and some players. Each game also has a gameOver status. A game may also have a winner and a loser. The Game class provides functions: to set and get the game information, set and get the deck of cards and set and get the players. It has functions: to deal cards (both for the initial hand of 2, and for additional cards), to reveal cards and the total value of a players hand. It has functions: to handle the choice between ace values, counting of aces, checking if players have bust or stood and the choice between "hit" and "stand". It has functions: to compare values when all players have chosen to "stand", to check for draws, and to compare player's hands to check for blackjack if there is a draw at 21. Finally, there are functions: to handle what happens when the game is over and identifying the winner and loser.
Version:
15.01.2025
Author:
Anne McCubbin

    • setCards

      public void setCards()
      Sets the cards in play to a regular pack of 52 cards by creating a Card object to represent each playing card, with its suit, title, value in the game of blackjack, and an card ID number.

    • getCards

      public ArrayList<Card> getCards()
      Returns the ArrayList of all Card objects.
      Returns:
      cards The ArrayList of all cards in the game.

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(String name)
      Sets the players of the game: one computer player, and one human player who is invited to input their name. Adds players to an ArrayList of players.

    • getPlayers

      public ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      Returns the ArrayList of players.
      Returns:
      players The ArrayList of players.

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver(boolean gameOver)
      Sets whether or not the game is over (true) or still in progress (false).
      Parameters:
      gameOver - A boolean true or false.

    • getGameOver

      public boolean getGameOver()
      Returns whether the game is over (true) or still in progress (false).
      Returns:
      gameOver A boolean true or false.

    • dealCard

      public void dealCard(Player player)
      Generates a random number between 0 and 51, to select a random card (from deck of 52) to issue to the player. If card was not in the deck (dealt to another player), another card is chosen. Card is dealt to player through player's setHand() function and its inDeck status is set to false.
      Parameters:
      player - The player a card is to be dealt to.

    • dealCards

      public void dealCards()
      Deals the initial cards at the start of the game. For every player in the game, dealCard() function is called twice to deal two cards to each player.

    • revealCards

      public void revealCards()
      Reveals the cards to the players, and calculates total hand value. If a player has an ace, handleAce() function called to deal with the decision between 1 and 11. Hand is not re-revealed or total re-calculated if a player has already stood.

    • handleAce

      public void handleAce(Player player)
      If a player has one or multiple aces, determines all possible values of their hand of cards, and if at least one value falls under 21, an ace Choice function is called to ask them to choose. Possible values are calculated from the player's handTotalValue - 10 (repeated for each ace that the player has in their hand.) If all possible values are over 21, the player is bust automatically.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who needs to make a choice.

    • humanAceChoice

      public void humanAceChoice(Player player, ArrayList<Integer> possibleValues)
      Asks for the human player's choice when they have an Ace, or several aces. The player is given the list of all possible values for their hand of cards. The player's handTotalValue is set to their choice.
      Parameters:
      possibleValues - The list of possible totals for their hand.

    • aceCount

      public int aceCount(ArrayList<Card> hand)
      Calculates the number of aces in a players hand.
      Parameters:
      hand - The hand of cards requiring its aces counted.
      Returns:
      aceCount The number of aces in the hand.

    • checkBustStood

      public void checkBustStood()
      Checks to see if any of the players have bust, stood, or won. If player has over 21, they are bust, and game is over. If all players have stood: - gameDraw() is used to check if they stood with the same value. - If there is a 'draw', and all players have 21, it will be a draw unless a single player has blackjack (11+10), in which case, the player with blackjack wins. - If there is a draw at any value under 21, the game is a draw. - If a single player has 21, and the others do not, that player wins. - Otherwise, getHighestStood() gets the player who has stood with the highest value under 21, who wins. If nobody has yet won or gone bust, the hitOrStand() function is called for the player.

    • allPlayersStood

      public boolean allPlayersStood()
      Checks to see if all players have stood.
      Returns:
      Boolean true (if all players have stood) or false (if not all have stood).

    • getHighestStood

      public Player getHighestStood()
      Finds the player who has chosen to 'stand' with the largest value under 21.
      Returns:
      highestStood The player who has stood with the highest value under 21.

    • hitOrStand

      public void hitOrStand(Player player)
      Asks players, if they are a human player, if they want to 'hit' (and draw another card) or 'stand' with the cards they have. If the player is a computer, it calls a hitStandChoice() function for the computer to make its choice. It is then announced for all players if they chose to 'stand' or draw another card.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is to make a choice between 'hit' and 'stand'

    • dealAnother

      public void dealAnother(Player player)
      Calls dealCard() function for the player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is needing another card.

    • gameDraw

      public boolean gameDraw()
      Function to check if game is a draw, which is called if all players have chosen to 'stand'. Compares the total hand value of all players hands to see if they are the same.
      Returns:
      Boolean true or false. Whether there is a draw (true) or not (false).

    • isBlackjack

      public void isBlackjack()
      Function to check if a score of 21 is blackjack (a 10 and an ace). Called when there is a draw and player has a score of 21.

    • allPlayersSameHandSize

      public boolean allPlayersSameHandSize()
      Function to check whether all players have the same number of cards in their hands. Called when multiple players have a score of 21 to check if they have the same number of cards, as a 21 from two cards will always win over any other 21.
      Returns:

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver(String winnerOrLoser, Player who)
      Function called to end the game when a player has won or gone bust. Sets gameOver status to true. Calls winnerOrLoser() function to identify winner and loser. Reveals computer's cards and score. Calls the newGameButton to appear on the screen.
      Parameters:
      winnerOrLoser - A String "winner" "loser" of "draw".
      who - The player who has ended the game.

    • winnerOrLoser

      public void winnerOrLoser(String winnerOrLoser, Player who)
      Function called from gameOver() to identify winner and loser. If the game was ended by the winner, the other player becomes the loser. If the game was ended by a loser, the other player will become winner unless they're bust. Labels are updated next to the players names to show this. If the game was a draw, neither loser or winner is set, and labels are updated to show 'Draw'.
      Parameters:
      winnerOrLoser - A String "winner" "loser" of "draw".
      who - The player who has ended the game.
